S.FORM: upitu pakiaturua musa ku ariatʉkʉrana arinani.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: umiapʉ cu, puaruma tarʉana umiapʉ pakiaturuana, amihla kapitanʉ tarʉana, “musiri! matitʉnʉlʉ!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It's time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: piataisa vahliungu mu amihla, “mavacangʉ pakiaturua.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: marumaru maci umiiapʉ, tumututuru pakiaturua ihlahlamu kari tahlana umarucacani.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Hla′alua language of numbers.

S.FORM: pialʉvʉ mu pakiaturua, pahlusahli cu a mu sahli umarucacani.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: macahlia ku matumuhlu kari tahlana.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Hla′alua languages.

S.FORM: ariari ku umaiiapʉ, ariari ku musuturu kari tahlana, tumua ku umahlikua ina'a tumimahla.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Hla′alua language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ngahla ku pia Caʉpʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Caʉpʉ。
My name is Caʉpʉ.

S.FORM: amaku ngahla pia Amahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Amahlʉ。
My dad's name is Amahlʉ.

S.FORM: inaku ngahla pia Inguru.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Inguru。
My mother's name is Inguru.

S.FORM: maahlʉ ku caihli mamisa.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: maru ku ahlalua hlahlusa cacihli, pia ʉlʉnganʉ kana'ana, laihla ucani caihli kana'ana mamisa.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫ʉlʉnganʉ，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is ʉlʉnganʉ, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: kikucu a mu ma ariatʉkʉrana umaiiapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: ihlaku nua ahlalua hlahlusa rianʉ marumuku pahlusahli.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: marumuku aku makahlangulu, maru maci taluavaʉlʉ, kiʉlʉsʉ ucani pihlingi a mu musa makahlangulu.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: marumuku ku pautuahlangi laʉlaʉvʉ varu'u, acahli a mu pahlulʉsʉ pahlusahli hla makahlangulu.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: mamaini ku tahlana Hla'alua
S.TRANSL: 我是拉阿魯哇族的小孩。
I am an Hla'alua child.

S.FORM: maruaru Rʉhlʉcʉ salia hlamu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在浮萍。
Our family lives in Rʉhlʉcʉ.

S.FORM: matarungahlʉ salia hlamu maru cucu'u lalima.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: salia hlamu maru ahlahlalua hlimihlimilavaʉ tatulu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: miaʉlʉsʉ aku ama'a, ina'a, ahlalua hlahlusa nua ahlalua ahlaina.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: amaku tam langica, amaku ia 'aumu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: tam mirihli a inaku, maisasavusavuanʉ inaku.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: ma salia macahlia ama'ana pialʉsʉ a mu masi kari tahlana.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Hla′alua language with us at home.

S.FORM: taluvaʉlʉ ahlamacicia rianʉ a mu puaili miararuma.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: matialʉsʉ matiasangalʉ ihlaku nua ahlahlalua tamuciakʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: tam marumuku a ku cucu salia hlamu.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: kipuhlu aku nua ina'a pasaulaula'ʉ arinani.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: tam valacuku langica sihlianʉ, kuasarʉmʉ kuacici langica mʉmʉa, tam matahlʉtʉkʉ varatʉna.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: mamu ahlahlapa sʉsʉsʉngʉa uumu pangʉ ， hlisahlikua tihla'ahlʉ tahliariana masunguli angatʉ 。
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: kʉlʉpʉngʉ mahlipapu aratavuhliu cu a langica.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai ku ina'a, tiaraisa matavuhliu a langica.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: amihla ina'a, taiaci'ai mʉcʉkʉhlʉ pariavaratʉ.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: uka'a lulunga langica ruvana, murumita cu a 'acangʉrahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: puaili cu a mu salia mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: puaili salia, sala'a makiniaku 'acangʉrahlʉ ahli'ai.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: ahli'ai kuacʉkʉhlʉ a pariavaratʉ, hlutumua ku kipuhlumana pasaulaula'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: ma patʉkʉ salia hlamu ariatʉkʉrana ku, ariari musasala ku mahlukua ariatʉkʉrana, musasala puaili salia mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ku taisa ariatʉkʉrana hlamu, uka'a tumahlaʉ mamaini umaiiapʉ arupautuahlangʉ cucu mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: ma parana sikuatitipa kiakukucu a mamainina, pasaulʉsʉ piataʉhlʉkai, pahlulʉsʉ makakari.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: macahlia pakiaturua pasaulʉsʉ hlamu pasaulaula'ʉ mʉmʉa, ihlaisa ia taisa pihlingi ariatʉkʉrana.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: ariari rianʉ hlamu maivʉtʉraʉ, kiakukucu patapuhlipuhli tarʉana umiapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: maru cucu'u sasahli cingarʉ, maru cucu'u maivʉtʉraʉ.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: maivʉtʉraʉ hlamu aucaucani parana 'aratingi, kiakukucu takulʉsʉ taku'i'iarʉ, tam mahlicungu a ariatʉkʉrana ariari.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: hlimusa ku miararuma takuliliungu tamu hlahlusa kiira
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: rahlua cu a mu kuapakita, tam miatatarʉ a ku isana.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: taratʉahlʉ ku tamu'u hlahlusa, makuakuaisa ihlaku uumu vakatʉ maami , makuakuaisa ihlaku miama sahlumu rahlʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: tam maami a hlilʉmʉkʉ isa tamuhlahlusana vakatʉ maami, tamuucu sa'au.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: marumuku a ku tamuhlahlusa isa sahlumu rahlʉngʉ mʉmʉa. tam mavacangʉ miima.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: marumaru maci mahlipapu, pahlaʉlʉsʉ aku nua tamuahlaina avavu kuamamahlipapu.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: hlivavu cu tamuahlaina tam marivacangʉ, maru vutukuhlu, maru turukuka, maru vusiakʉ, marumana tavuhlinga.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: kualʉpʉngʉ kuamamahlipapu, musa mu tatahlatʉngʉa rumavi hlatʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: umala tamuahlaina matumuhlu mairangʉ, intavangʉ hla takʉcʉngʉ uvura ihlaku, avura ihlaku mahlava puaili salia.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: aruparuahlʉamu, amihla arupakita cucuaari.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: ruavici pakiaturua ihlahlamu musa taupangana kulikulikuli'i, ma mu sipangʉhlʉva patavʉhlʉrʉ pu'a cukahlangʉ.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: mulavaʉ puaruma taupangana kulikulikuli'i amihla pakiaturua, “ahlicuvungana ia ngahlana ahlamʉ, ilikusuna ngahlana vuhli'i, kiakukucu takacicihli kumita.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: muluahlʉ ku vuhli'i, kuhlaisai kuaku kumita ngahlana vuhli'i.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: taratʉahlʉ cu a ku matumuhlu ahlamʉ, ma ahlahlapa kiu'u miapipihlihli, taratʉahlʉ mana tapʉ'ʉna ma 'isʉngʉrʉ malusapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: taupangana kulikulikuli'i maru kalavungu mʉlʉngʉsʉ ngunguru, tarʉmʉcʉ kavahlʉ nua lukuhlu, angahli kiariari kunaku akita kani'i kuli'i, arinani hlikumitacu tamuucu masasangarʉ tʉkʉ.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: hlipitumuhlu cu a ku 'ahlingu, pakita hlamama ku.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: mungahlʉ tumua mʉlʉvʉ hlamama ku mʉcʉkʉhlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: taluvaʉlana ari kani'i, hlikisuamu ahlalua ahlaina musa Taitu takuliliungu tamalʉngalʉ.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: angahli a mu Taipakʉ mutatungusa likihli apuhlu musa Taitu.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: miungu cu Taitu, mulikihli tamalʉngalʉna mʉcʉkʉhlʉ utatungusa likihli ruavici ihlahlamu.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: kuuasaihla aatʉ utatungusa likihlina saliaisa tamalʉngalʉna, mulikihli mu'alivatʉna ia miungu cu.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: liliunga saliaisa tamalʉngalʉ maru tam taisa taupangana 'ivingi, mʉlʉsʉamu likihli umarua sapahlʉ musa mahlukua taupangana 'ivingi.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: ma taupangana 'ivingi, ruavici tamalʉngalʉ amu pau 'ukui nua mutatungusa tarʉmʉcʉ kavahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: ruvana, kualʉsiamu musa mahlukua miararuma ikatumahlama uumau kuaruvaruvana.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: tamtumuhlu likihli a miararuma ikatumahlana, kuhlaisai mulikihliamu likihli umaru 'urai musa kaaiu.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: akuku miacikiri, pausu'ulu paralikapi cu, mutungusucuamu likihli kikucu musa.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: puailicuamu Taipakʉ kani'i, paitatʉahlicui likihliisa umaru 'urai tamalʉngalʉna.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: akuku maimi mana, maruaru amu rʉhlʉcʉ, mulavaʉ umaiiapʉ, ahlausuhlu cu a Takau, rianʉ ma ikatumahlana mangusipi.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在高中，上學以後，就搬到了高雄，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Haising. After I started school, we moved to Kaohsiung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: ma cu ariataisa mulavaʉ, tiapili a ku ucani siatuturu a apulavaʉ vunguka isa cucumacu, macahli tarʉtatʉkʉhlʉ siaravacangʉ vunguka isa Taivangʉ cucumacu.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: kuhlaisai, taluamacicia mamisa, ihlaku nua ahlalua hlahlusa puaili miararuma takuliliungu hlamama, hlatumua macacahlia tahlana vunguka takacicihli.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: malʉhlʉ caihli cu a hlamamana, hla kitaʉia maraiahlʉ mana tamalʉngalʉ .
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai ku kana'ana tainini macahliisa kari, tam masivacangʉ kari Hla'alua, macahlia mʉmʉa masi kari sumukuhlu, kari puutu hla kari 'aumu.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的拉阿魯哇語說得很流利，也會說布農語、客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Hla'alua, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: hlipakisuahlai ku kana'ana iniciki macahlia, usuanganaiau hlimusuturu kari 'aumu akuku mainimana, usumanʉisa ia cucu tahlana sumukuhlu ma ta'iaraisana tumahlaʉ pautuahlangʉisa cucupuutu, kuhlaisai matumuhlu a acahlisa kari.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: akuku takuliliungu amu, hlimakakari hlamamana tam tumuhlu ausikan siaracahlia isa mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: maniki a mu kutuahlʉ rianʉ a timatakahlangʉ, hla maru a mu uruamia 'arivungua sipiakiatitipa, acahli maiatuhluhlu tumimahla.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: akuku mainimana kuaku macahlia tahlana vunguka takacicihli, marinu aku mahlikua cucumacu.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: matumuhlu siaracahlia rumahlaʉ tumacacurunucikia mara cucu tahlana Hla'alua, pakaritʉkʉhlʉcikia apausakisakiricikia.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為拉阿魯哇族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Hla'alua is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: kʉlʉpʉngʉ mahlipapu arinani, puaili cu a salia hlimilavaʉ hlahlusana.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: kisasuamu tamu ahlaina musa tai'a'ana tarʉtatʉatʉkʉhlʉ pu'a turukuka, pahlalalangʉ avavu kuaruvaruvana uvura hlimilavaʉ hlahlusa.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: micalivicu a mu i'a'ana hlatʉngʉ, maru a i'a'ana hlatʉngʉ matumuhlu mavacangʉ hlatʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: hlipu'a a mu takungukungu, vukuri hla caipu matavuhliu.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: patʉkʉ cucui'a'ana masukiu'u amihla, “tam maami a pangʉtahlʉ hla 'ukuhlucu mimiliki ku. pu'akia mainimaini mau!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: hlipu'a cu mu pangʉtahlʉ hla 'ukuhlucu mimiliki.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: micalivi amu i'a'ana papa'a, amihla cucui'a'ana, “ngasa pu'au? taisa hla mavʉhlʉ a turukukana arinani, utulu hlimiungu ucani.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: cacurunu tamuahlainana tamuucu langʉlangʉ, pakisuahlai cucui'a'ana acahli i mainimainikia kulangʉlangʉ.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: hla amihla cucui'a'ana tam kulangʉlangʉ, kucu tuahlʉ mariahlamasʉ.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: patʉkʉ cucui'a'ana amihla, muara pu'a vutukuhlu ku, taisa hla kulangʉlangʉ vutukuhlu ku.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: mulavaʉ pu'a cu amu turukuka pu'a cu vutukuhlu mʉmʉa, puaili salia pahlacani tuu'una camai.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: rahlua cu a upapalu, sʉsʉma cu a langica.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: pata'arivungua hlimilavaʉ hlahlusa puaili amihla, umarilʉmʉlʉmʉ kutuahlicu taluavaʉlʉ, mungahlʉ taluavaʉlana ari iniciki puaili.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: amihla tamu ahlainana hliavavucu a matumuhlu, pakuvavau rianʉ a cucu'u kualʉsikia uumu!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: makuakuamu muricucu kualʉsʉ uumu kuavacangʉ siacalaia kuaruvaruvana.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: maru cacihli laʉlaʉviku pia Caʉpʉisana, karʉkʉhlʉ kana'ana asapu mahlava cacalaisa.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Caʉpʉna，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Caʉpʉna, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: akuku umaiaiapʉ, umahlikua kana'ana laʉlaʉvʉisa umuhli siasuhlatʉ, siasamusu ahla siakatʉka.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: mungahlʉ, mupapuahlʉ, mutatuluhlu, rianʉ mʉmʉa umauhlisana.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: maru a takuliacʉ isa, karʉkʉhlʉ umuhli kua apuaili.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: ulavaisa riani cu kupauhli isana.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: maru ucani ari, kiʉlʉsia amu musa mutatahluvatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: sala aisa, hlatumua Caʉpʉna musa tatiahla, hlaa asapu kana'ana mahlava sipiarisi.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Caʉpʉna想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Caʉpʉna wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: umahlikua laʉlaʉvʉisa kana'ana umuhli sipiarisi, ahli'aimau rianʉ mʉmʉa masiaili amihla, kuaku mahlava mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

S.FORM: mutʉngʉtʉngʉ tumangi, umarucarucakʉ kana'ana amihla, “tiaramu mʉmʉa kupauhli ihlaku sipiarisi.”
S.TRANSL: Caʉpʉna急的哭了出來。他生氣的說：「為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙。」
Caʉpʉna burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: kihlamuhlamu laʉlaʉvʉisa kana'ana, ta'iaraisaka kuu takacicihli mahlava, hla hliumuhli kuapuaili pahlivinga, ihlau kuu apuaili.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: umaiiapʉ matata, mualualu Caʉpʉna mahlukua ariatʉkʉrana, hliuhliana Caʉpʉna sapialaliacu mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Caʉpʉna很早就到學校了，Caʉpʉna把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Caʉpʉna arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: umahlikua laʉlaʉvʉisa kana'ana akuainita'ai, hla amihla cucuaari tʉtʉrʉaku takacicihli mahlava pahlivinga, sia'ʉ'ʉraisamana mʉmʉa pauhli ihlaku pahlivinga.
S.TRANSL: Caʉpʉna向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Caʉpʉna apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: amaku ia miararuma cucu mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: akuku mainimana, musa ama'a nua tamalʉngalʉ vuvulunga ruvana, mahlava hlitakʉ hla hlahlitu.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: sihlangʉ, mahlava hlipanaisa hlakana'ana kuli'i puaili.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: marumaru maci alʉmʉhlʉ, marumaru maci laarʉ, apahlapa maru hlatarʉaʉ mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: maru kana'ana miararuma pususua papa'a, uvara cucutahlana siacalai.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: apiarasʉ a ku ama'ana, tumua mʉlʉvʉ ama'ana musa mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: amihla ama'ana macu a ku arataisa iniciki ruavici ihlaku musa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: hlahlahlusa miararuma macahlia mʉmʉa maruamia ringai matiasangalʉ kuli'i, macahlia hlakana'ana tumamahlʉngʉ tilu hla 'acʉvʉ.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: tam macahlia amaku tumamahlʉngʉ tilu, amihla ama'ana, kani'ina maruamia matiasangalʉ hlatarʉaʉ, puamahlʉmahlʉngʉ amu hlikiramia kuli'i, ikaku tatahlʉ kuli'i a ringai.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: marapihli tuahlʉ makulai mʉlʉvʉ hlamama muasa mʉrʉcʉka, ariari a ku takutatahlamʉ tumahlʉngʉ ringai, macuisa makulai ringai ku maritʉahlʉ kuli'i.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: kumita ama'a rumahlaʉ hliulavalava cu ku cucuaari mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定很會打獵。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: arataisa cu a ku kani'i, mataraingi a ku vuuru hla ripasʉ, mʉlʉvʉ ama'a musa mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: macu a puaili miararuma rumahlaʉ hlipana kuli'i pupusuaisana cucutahlana.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: amihla ama'ana, sia'ʉ'ʉraisa 'ihlacu langica, uvura ihlata matumuhlu kuli'i.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: pasaʉrʉkʉcicuaku maivʉvʉrʉnga akuisa musa umiiapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: akuisa musa ariatʉkʉrana rumahlaʉ , asapucuaku mahlava luvucu.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: kuaku ahlava rianʉ pahlivinga.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: akuisa umaiaiapʉ rumahlaʉ, pulʉsʉaku laʉlaʉvʉ kumakita suhlatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: akuisa kiatarari rumahlaʉ, pauhli a laʉlaʉvʉ ihlakua siasuhlatʉ hla siasamusu.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kihlamuhlamua pakiaturua ihlakua, “pasakulaikiia umacʉka mungahlangahla, kucikiia pasaʉrʉkʉcʉ!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: ngahla isa tukucu ku ia Mai, kana'ana ia ihlaisa mʉmʉa mamaini Hla'alua.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Mai，他也是拉阿魯哇族的小孩。
My good friend's name is Mai, and he is also an Hla'alua child.

S.FORM: ma amu Rʉhlʉcʉ pasaʉlʉsʉ umiiapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在Rʉhlʉcʉ部落讀書。
We study together in the Rʉhlʉcʉ tribe.

S.FORM: karʉkʉhlʉ amu pasaʉlʉsʉ tumimahla hlamama kisuahlahlama, rianʉamu tam macahlia masi kari Hla'alua.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說拉阿魯哇語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Hla'alua proficiently.

S.FORM: tam langicaku tam mavʉhlʉ aku mʉmʉa, tam mikasekase hla tam mirihlia Mai.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Mai很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Mai is short and thin.

S.FORM: tam kuatitipa Mai, tam marumukua cucu'u mʉmʉa kana'ana.
S.TRANSL: Mai很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Mai is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: arinani ia sikurarau kuatitipa ariatʉkʉrana, hlikuraraucua ariatʉkʉrana matumuhlua sitarisia.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: maarua rʉkʉcʉ siakilia, pisuvatʉrʉ taʉhlʉkai, mitahlahlʉ, musurauvu hla kuurivuuru.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: tarisia ku mitahlahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: akuku mitahlahlʉ rumahlaʉ, milakupu cu aku, murukipuhlu cara'ʉ lasahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ucaniika akuku umacʉka rumahlaʉ, tapihlusuhlusu tapikakua ahliacuvungu.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: akuku miungu ualava ia masasangarʉa cucu'u mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: manikia ku atʉahlʉ hlikicualu, ucaanika masasangarʉa ku, ta'iaraisaka pasalipingicuaku sitarisia.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: kisasuaku ama'a kiira musa takuliliungu tamalʉngalʉ.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: marahlivuhlivu a sapahlʉisa tamalʉngalʉna.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kihlamuhlamu a kana'ana ihlahlamu. milaluihli a hlialuvuna.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: matiangahlangahla a kana'ana rumahlaʉ, angahli hlialuvu mutupiakʉ.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: hlimahlava a ama'ana papakalavungu hla saviki uvura tamalʉngalʉ.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: maku tatara nua tamalʉngalʉna arupakakari, matumuhlu a hlikihlahlamuisa kana'ana kisuahlahlama.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: miacikiriaku mualualu rumahlaʉ, puvahli a tamalʉngalʉ ihlaku mahlulangicacu, mataingalʉ aramasalangʉsangicu mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: amihla ihlaku, “maci aramahlʉngicu a sapahlʉ tamalʉngalʉna ia, muacʉkʉhlʉkia saliahlamu takuliliungu.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: ma usua hlimiaili mapuahlʉ usua caihli, makarikari a siihuna umahlikua cucumacu pakipuhlu cukahlangʉ cucu'una palungu ngahla.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: rahlua pakisusuahlai umahlikua siihu makikini pakipuhlu cukahlangʉ cucu'u palungu ngahlana alamuru Hlakuta'i savangʉana.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Hlakuta'i savangʉana。
I interviewed Noami Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: hlipitʉtʉrʉaku kana'ana kani'i taluavaʉlana musa saliaisa kana'ana pakisuahlai.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ma pakisusuahlai pasamiana, kihlamuhlamu a kana'ana ihlaku hliangahlahlana pahlumiamia ngahlaisa, ruavici ihlaku mʉmʉa pautuahlangi cucusaliaisa hla miararumaisa.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: pakisuahlaiaku kana'ana tiaraisa maisukasʉ puliuhlu palungu ngahla, ku i avacangʉ sitakuamia kiariarina?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: umalivalʉ a kana'ana ihlaku, ta'iaraisaka suhlatʉ hlakʉsaiana ku macuisa sipiaʉngʉca ngahlaisa, maarumana usumanʉ pia kana'ana 「撒先生」, kuhlaisai. tam pi sitahliasulua.
S.TRANSL: which resulted in many jokes being made.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him Na Xian Sheng

S.FORM: amihla Hlakuta'i savangʉana, siasuhlatʉ cucumacu ngahlana ia, ihlaisa macuisa sipiangʉngʉca ngahlahlamu, ngahlaku ia hlaka tahlanahlamu, pihlingihlamu, cukahlangʉhlamu cucu'u, ahliki'aiia tumahlaʉ cucutahlana tuahlʉ maitʉahlʉ palungu ngahla takacicihli.
S.TRANSL: our family
Noami Kulas said, The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: kisasuaku tamu'u ahlaina kiira musa parana i'a'ana, hlimahlava a tamu'u ahlainana matumuhlu hlatʉngʉ hlitakacicihlisa lʉmʉmʉkʉ, hlitumamahlʉngʉ mʉmʉa anʉanʉaisa cucumacu panaisa cucu'u.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: tam marumuku a cucu'u i'a'anaisa tamu'u ahlaina, tumahlaʉ a cucu'u pu'a samʉsamʉ hla kʉrʉsa marʉmʉ, tumahlaʉ a cucu'u mʉcʉkʉhlʉ kutahlamʉ hliavavaisa camai.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: tam sa'au a hliavavaisa taliri hla tangusuhlu, maarumana hlipahlatarua papaalʉmʉhlʉ hlipatakua imuu, pahluisa mariakuanʉ tumahlaʉ cucu'u, rianʉ a cucu'u mʉcʉkʉhlʉ i'a'anahlamu patavʉhlʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: avavuavu a tamu'una rumahlaʉ, maku patʉkʉ maritara'ʉhla cucu'u, maku patʉkʉ makuvau. “kani'i hlatʉngʉna rianʉ hlitakacicihla lʉmʉmʉkʉ, hlitakacicihli tumangura, pasakulai mʉcʉkʉhlʉ pu'a.”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: makulai a i'a'ahlamu pukucuaʉ, amihla tamu'u ahlainana, “ta'iaraisaka hlapataliliviu.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, It's all thanks to your help.""

S.FORM: kani'i sikurarauna matumuhlu a hliusuturuaku cacalaisa hlitakacicihli tumangura hla siaana siaracahlia cucumacu, hlaa hlipautuhluhlu takualangʉlangʉ i'a'a.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: pausu'uluaku arumukaisa tamu'una anʉanʉa mairahlu cucumacu, tacacurunaaku tam puavahli hla malitʉnʉlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
